summary: Kenneth S McHargh was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is listed in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978, specifically in documents covering May, October, and November. These documents detail the employees of the HSCA, their positions, annual salaries, and gross pay for the specified accounting periods. While the documents confirm his employment, they do not specify his exact role or responsibilities within the committee.
significance: Kenneth S McHargh's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the assassination of JFK. As an employee listed in payroll and certification reports, he was part of the team involved in this investigation, though the specific nature and impact of his contribution are not detailed in these documents.
